intro: Effusiella listerophora, commonly known as the creeping liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its flattened, ribbon-like leaves that grow close to the ground, forming dense mats. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, contain spores that are dispersed by wind. Effusiella listerophora plays a vital role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
